author: Polly Toynbee

text: Personally, I would be delighted if there were a life after death, especially if it permitted me to continue to learn about this world and others, if it gave me a chance to discover how history turns out.
author: Carl Sagan

text: The elimination of the fear of death transforms the individual's way of being in the world.
author: Stanislav Grof

text: Each day is a little life: every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: I don't want to hear about my death.
author: Oriana Fallaci

text: I get scared to death when I see people who say they've found Jesus Christ, and they're out there, and I wonder, who's teaching them? Who's mentoring them?
author: Willie Aames

text: Humanity should question itself, once more, about the absurd and always unfair phenomenon of war, on whose stage of death and pain only remain standing the negotiating table that could and should have prevented it.
author: Pope John Paul II

text: Death gives meaning to our lives. It gives importance and value to time. Time would become meaningless if there were too much of it.
author: Ray Kurzweil

text: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish it's source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
author: Anais Nin

text: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: You only live twice. Once when you are born and once when you look death in the face.
author: Ian Fleming

text: People think celebrities don't have to worry about human things like sickness and death and rent. It's like you've traveled to this Land of Celebrity, this other country.
author: David Duchovny

text: Any film which views the darker side of life, which is death with a sense of humor, is very much to my taste.
author: Carter Burwell

text: There is no lonelier man in death, except the suicide, than that man who has lived many years with a good wife and then outlived her. If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The government is tottering. We must deal it the death blow an any cost. To delay action is the same as death.
author: Vladimir Lenin

text: I thank my God for graciously granting me the opportunity of learning that death is the key which unlocks the door to our true happiness.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

text: Because I could not stop for death, He kindly stopped for me The carriage held but just ourselves and immortality.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: The approach of death certainly concentrates the mind.
author: A. N. Wilson

text: Have an earnestness for death and you will have life.
author: Abu Bakr

text: For days after death hair and fingernails continue to grow, but phone calls taper off.
author: Johnny Carson

text: Deep down, no one really believes they have a right to live. But this death sentence generally stays tucked away, hidden beneath the difficulty of living. If that difficulty is removed from time to time, death is suddenly there, unintelligibly.
author: Jean Baudrillard

text: Even when you're making a movie about life, death is a presence, and I guess it's part of my dramatic viewpoint. I'm not sure why exactly. Maybe I'm drawn to it as a story element.
author: Gus Van Sant

text: All interest in disease and death is only another expression of interest in life.
author: Thomas Mann

text: If my survival caused another to perish, then death would be sweeter and more beloved.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Life is a predicament which precedes death.
author: Henry James

text: I was extended secret service protection during my presidential run in 1984, when I received the most death threats ever made toward a candidate.
author: Jesse Jackson

text: Do the thing we fear, and death of fear is certain.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: If I die prematurely I shall be saved from being bored to death at my own success.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.
author: Anais Nin

text: Death doesn't affect the living because it has not happened yet. Death doesn't concern the dead because they have ceased to exist.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: In the attempt to defeat death man has been inevitably obliged to defeat life, for the two are inextricably related. Life moves on to death, and to deny one is to deny the other.
author: Henry Miller

text: They tell us that suicide is the greatest piece of cowardice... that suicide is wrong when it is quite obvious that there is nothing in the world to which every man has a more unassailable title than to his own life and person.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Marriage can be viewed as the waiting room for death.
author: Mike Myers

text: A Shakespearean tragedy as so far considered may be called a story of exceptional calamity leading to the death of a man in high estate. But it is clearly much more than this, and we have now to regard it from another side.
author: Andrew Coyle Bradley

text: It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure on the world.
author: John Steinbeck

text: When you think about it, the end of the world is a little bit like death: We all know it's going to come eventually, and as we get older, we feel we see the signs more and more distinctly.
author: John Hodgman

text: The death of democracy is not likely to be an assassination from ambush. It will be a slow extinction from apathy, indifference, and undernourishment.
author: Robert M. Hutchins

text: Monarchs ought to put to death the authors and instigators of war, as their sworn enemies and as dangers to their states.
author: Elizabeth I

text: I was taught to confront things you can't avoid. Death is one of those things. To live in a society where you're trying not to look at it is stupid because looking at death throws us back into life with more vigour and energy. The fact that flowers don't last for ever makes them beautiful.
author: Damien Hirst

text: I'm watching the Weather Channel more than I've ever watched it. I'm scared to death it's going to rain.
author: John Elway

text: Death is a challenge. It tells us not to waste time... It tells us to tell each other right now that we love each other.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: I just finished my homework fast, I was bored to death. There wasn't 500 channels so there was a thing for a librarian to teach a kid like me about reading. I started reading early and I read all the time, because I love it.
author: Harvey Weinstein

text: Death would not be called bad, O people, if one knew how to truly die.
author: Guru Nanak

text: Lots of people there seemed to be in denial, in absolute denial, of death - everybody's pretending that death doesn't happen in L.A. if you do enough exercise and take enough wheatgrass and have your pill every day, you might not die.
author: Emily Mortimer

text: Death is only a larger kind of going abroad.
author: Samuel Butler

text: There is nothing glamorous about death.
author: Roger Moore

text: Success is like death. The more successful you become, the higher the houses in the hills get and the higer the fences get.
author: Kevin Spacey

text: Everybody is entertained to death.
author: Brian Eno

text: Prepare a noble death song for the day when you go over the great divide.
author: Tecumseh

text: If death is in the room, it's pretty interesting. But I would also say that I'm interested in getting myself to believe that it's going to happen to me. I'm interested in it, because if you're not, you're nuts. It's really de facto what we're here to find out about.
author: George Saunders

text: I were better to be eaten to death with a rust than to be scoured to nothing with perpetual motion.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The call of death is a call of love. Death can be sweet if we answer it in the affirmative, if we accept it as one of the great eternal forms of life and transformation.
author: Hermann Hesse

text: If you make every game a life and death proposition, you're going to have problems. For one thing, you'll be dead a lot.
author: Dean Smith

text: I've looked that old scoundrel death in the eye many times but this time I think he has me on the ropes.
author: Douglas MacArthur

text: When life is victorious, there is birth when it is thwarted, there is death. A warrior is always engaged in a life-and-death struggle for Peace.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

text: I am bound to add that the excess in too little has ever proved in me more dangerous than the excess in too much the last may cause indigestion, but the first causes death.
author: Giacomo Casanova

text: I have two luxuries to brood over in my walks, your loveliness and the hour of my death. O that I could have possession of them both in the same minute.
author: John Keats

text: To be immortal is commonplace except for man, all creatures are immortal, for they are ignorant of death what is divine, terrible, incomprehensible, is to know that one is immortal.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

text: Life is but a moment, death also is but another.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.
author: Norman Cousins

text: The knowledge of the realm of death makes it possible for the shaman to move freely back and forth and mediate these journeys for other people.
author: Stanislav Grof

text: I hate to say this, but I'll repeat it: After death, all we know that you do is stink.
author: Jack Kevorkian

text: Planning to play: that's what saving for retirement is today - and it is antithetical to the nature of play, fully within the definition of work, and blissfully ignorant of the reality of death.
author: John Thorn

text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
author: Buddha

text: What we think of as our sensitivity is only the higher evolution of terror in a poor dumb beast. We suffer for nothing. Our own death wish is our only real tragedy.
author: Mario Puzo

text: Only those who spread treachery, fire, and death out of hatred for the prosperity of others are undeserving of pity.
author: Jose Marti

text: But I was very, very lucky, and it was a wake up call as far as motorbikes are concerned. I never flirted with death on the bike, but now I'm totally convinced they're death machines.
author: Liam Neeson

text: Ordinary people seem not to realize that those who really apply themselves in the right way to philosophy are directly and of their own accord preparing themselves for dying and death.
author: Socrates

text: Pale Death beats equally at the poor man's gate and at the palaces of kings.
author: Horace

text: Death is easier than a wretched life and better never to have born than to live and fare badly.
author: Aeschylus

text: The essence of the Hebrew Bible, transmitted by Christianity, is separation: between life and death, nature and God, good and evil, man and woman, and the holy and the profane.
author: Dennis Prager

text: Quarreling over food and drink, having neither scruples nor shame, not knowing right from wrong, not trying to avoid death or injury, not fearful of greater strength or of greater numbers, greedily aware only of food and drink - such is the bravery of the dog and boar.
author: Xun Zi

text: If we don't know life, how can we know death?
author: Confucius

text: And, in a funny way, each death is different and you mourn each death differently and each death brings back the death you mourned earlier and you get into a bit of a pile-up.
author: Nigella Lawson

text: We have abolished the death penalty for humans, so why should it continue for animals?
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: The ideal death, I think, is what was the ideal Victorian death, you know, with your grandchildren around you, a bit of sobbing. And you say goodbye to your loved ones, making certain that one of them has been left behind to look after the shop.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: The world is put back by the death of every one who has to sacrifice the development of his or her peculiar gifts to conventionality.
author: Florence Nightingale

text: Death is not natural for a state as it is for a human being, for whom death is not only necessary, but frequently even desirable.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: I look upon death to be as necessary to our constitution as sleep. We shall rise refreshed in the morning.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Fear of death has never played a large part in my consciousness - perhaps unimaginative of me.
author: A. N. Wilson

text: Death ends a life, not a relationship.
author: Jack Lemon

text: I didn't attend the funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
author: Mark Twain

text: Prohibit the taking of omens, and do away with superstitious doubts. Then, until death itself comes, no calamity need be feared.
author: Sun Tzu

text: We weep over the graves of infants and the little ones taken from us by death but an early grave may be the shortest way to heaven.
author: Tryon Edwards

text: When your time comes to die, be not like those whose hearts are filled with fear of death, so that when their time comes they weep and pray for a little more time to live their lives over again in a different way. Sing your death song, and die like a hero going home.
author: Tecumseh

text: But I have been in some very beautiful churches, then I've looked outside and seen people starving to death.
author: Don Van Vliet

text: There is no easy walk to freedom anywhere, and many of us will have to pass through the valley of the shadow of death again and again before we reach the mountaintop of our desires.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I think that obviously, there is a perverse attraction to a fundamentally changed world or the end of the world. There is a death wish, a perverse death wish. Not just for ourselves, not just for the movie 'Death Wish,' but for the end of all human life.
author: John Hodgman

text: It's funny, though, speaking of fathers and sons, because me and John Goodman played father and son, like, five or six years ago in the film 'Death Sentence,' and I got back with him again in 'Inside Llewyn Davis.'
author: Garrett Hedlund

text: The history of the world is the record of the weakness, frailty and death of public opinion.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Belief is the death of intelligence.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

text: I feel like I don't watch that many shows with death.
author: Lena Dunham

text: I believe the death of Bobby Kennedy was in many ways the death of decency in America. I think it was the death of manners and formality, the death of poetry and the death of a dream.
author: Emilio Estevez

text: Normality is death.
author: Theodor Adorno

text: The very essence of literature is the war between emotion and intellect, between life and death. When literature becomes too intellectual - when it begins to ignore the passions, the emotions - it becomes sterile, silly, and actually without substance.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

text: Of all the artists on Death Row, none of them went bankrupt.
author: Suge Knight

text: The compact which exists between the North and the South is a covenant with death and an agreement with hell.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

text: The need to understand prescription information can literally be a matter of life and death.
author: Andrew Cuomo

text: After my mother's death, I had such difficulty relating to people.
author: Jaron Lanier

text: We burned to death 100,000 Japanese civilians in Tokyo - men, women and children. LeMay recognized that what he was doing would be thought immoral if his side had lost. But what makes it immoral if you lose and not immoral if you win?
author: Robert McNamara

text: A revolution is a struggle to the death between the future and the past.
author: Fidel Castro

text: In Seattle, I soon found that my radical ideas and aesthetic explorations - ideas and explorations that in Richmond, Virginia, might have gotten me stoned to death with hush puppies - were not only accepted but occasionally applauded.
author: Tom Robbins

text: Before I pitch any game, from spring training to Game 7 of the World Series, I'm scared to death.
author: Curt Schilling

text: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Nature creates while destroying, and doesn't care whether it creates or destroys as long as life isn't extinguished, as long as death doesn't lose its rights.
author: Ivan Turgenev

text: Since fame is an illusion and death is in our future all we have is the next moment before we are swallowed into oblivion.
author: Al Goldstein

text: It is possible to provide security against other ills, but as far as death is concerned, we men live in a city without walls.
author: Epicurus

text: Does not the very word 'creative' mean to build, to initiate, to give out, to act - rather than to be acted upon, to be subjective? Living photography is positive in its approach, it sings a song of life - not death.
author: Berenice Abbott

text: Death is not the worst that can happen to men.
author: Plato

text: Everything one does in life, even love, occurs in an express train racing toward death. To smoke opium is to get out of the train while it is still moving. It is to concern oneself with something other than life or death.
author: Jean Cocteau

text: People on death row, the treatment of animals, women's right to choose. So much in America is based on religious fundamentalist Christianity. Grow up! This is the modern world!
author: Eddie Vedder

text: I offer neither pay, nor quarters, nor food I offer only hunger, thirst, forced marches, battles and death. Let him who loves his country with his heart, and not merely with his lips, follow me.
author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

text: If the human condition were the periodic table, maybe love would be hydrogen at No. 1. Death would be helium at No. 2. Power, I reckon, would be where oxygen is.
author: David Mitchell

text: He who doesn't fear death dies only once.
author: Giovanni Falcone

text: Some men are alive simply because it is against the law to kill them.
author: E. W. Howe

text: Divorce is probably as painful as death.
author: William Shatner

text: When I die, don't let my death stop the resistance.
author: Muqtada al Sadr

text: Football (soccer) is a matter of life and death, except more important.
author: Bill Shankly

text: Salman Rushdie, indeed any writer who abuses the prophet or indeed any prophet under Islamic law, the sentence for that is actually death.
author: Cat Stevens

text: The death of Pope John Paul II led many of different faiths and of no faith to acknowledge their debt to the Roman Catholic Church for holding on to absolutes that the rest of us can measure ourselves against.
author: Suzanne Fields

text: Death is the golden key that opens the palace of eternity.
author: John Milton

text: Death is someone you see very clearly with eyes in the center of your heart: eyes that see not by reacting to light, but by reacting to a kind of a chill from within the marrow of your own life.
author: Thomas Merton

text: Whenever death may surprise us, let it be welcome if our battle cry has reached even one receptive ear and another hand reaches out to take up our arms.
author: Che Guevara

text: Absence and death are the same - only that in death there is no suffering.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Pale death, with impartial step, knocks at the hut of the poor and the towers of kings.
author: Horace

text: I can't turn on the television without seeing me, or open the newspaper without seeing me and, honestly, I'm sick to death of me.
author: Elizabeth Edwards

text: It is the cause, not the death, that makes the martyr.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: You realize that however much you don't think about death - or think that's for other people - you're just an organism living from day to day. I'm just grateful I'm here.
author: Robin Gibb

text: I've always had bronchitis. I've been administered the Sacrament of Death three times for it.
author: Mercedes McCambridge

text: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death. If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

text: It is natural to indulge in the illusions of hope. We are apt to shut our eyes to that siren until she allures us to our death.
author: Gertrude Stein

text: Perhaps we don't need these religious concoctions to pillow the fear of death. Just the fact that there is an unknown, and something greater, can bring a feeling of peace. That's enough for me.
author: Brad Pitt

text: Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?
author: Plato

text: We do not celebrate the death of our enemies.
author: Yitzhak Rabin

text: The death of a beautiful woman, is unquestionably the most poetical topic in the world.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: The cult of the individual is killing us. I think Twitter signals the death of western civilisation, but people have been saying that since Demosthenes.
author: Kate Atkinson

text: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them and that is eternity.
author: Edvard Munch

text: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I now bid farewell to the country of my birth - of my passions - of my death a country whose misfortunes have invoked my sympathies - whose factions I sought to quell - whose intelligence I prompted to a lofty aim - whose freedom has been my fatal dream.
author: Thomas Francis Meagher

text: I don't fear death because I don't fear anything I don't understand. When I start to think about it, I order a massage and it goes away.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: There is no fundamental difference between the preparation for death and the practice of dying, and spiritual practice leading to enlightenment.
author: Stanislav Grof

text: I looked Death right in the face.
author: Travis Barker

text: The main facts in human life are five: birth, food, sleep, love and death.
author: E. M. Forster

text: The line between life or death is determined by what we are willing to do.
author: Bear Grylls

text: Nobody with an IQ higher than emergency-room temperature could ever believe that 'death panels' would be appointed to nudge the elderly toward euthanasia. Yet for idle entertainment, it's hard to beat Sarah Palin's ignorant nattering on the subject.
author: Carl Hiaasen

text: Death is a fearful thing.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Die, v.: To stop sinning suddenly.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Death is inevitable, but Life - that's the tricky bit where things happen.
author: Simon Travaglia

text: It is not tolerable, it is not possible, that from so much death, so much sacrifice and ruin, so much heroism, a greater and better humanity shall not emerge.
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: The passion of hatred is so long lived and so obstinate a malady that the surest sign of death in a sick person is their desire for reconciliation.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

text: I think that the core doctrines of Christianity - the incarnation, the resurrection, life after death-these are as strong as ever. In fact, the belief in life after death has increased in this century.
author: Andrew Greeley

text: We march and fight, to death or on to victory. Our might is right, no traitors shall prevail. Our hearts are steeled against the fiery gates of hell. No shot or shell, can still our mighty song.
author: George Lincoln Rockwell

text: It is impossible to experience one's death objectively and still carry a tune.
author: Woody Allen

text: All violence consists in some people forcing others, under threat of suffering or death, to do what they do not want to do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: I'll keep peace at all cost, even if I choke to death on my tongue.
author: Paula Deen

text: Death and vulgarity are the only two facts in the nineteenth century that one cannot explain away.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are, as is known, insects that die in the moment of fertilization. So it is with all joy: life's highest, most splendid moment of enjoyment is accompanied by death.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: When you break up, your whole identity is shattered. It's like death.
author: Dennis Quaid

text: In this situation I was constantly exposed to danger and death.
author: Daniel Boone

text: If forgers and malefactors are put to death by the secular power, there is much more reason for excommunicating and even putting to death one convicted of heresy.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Death, like birth, is a secret of Nature.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: There's stuff I don't like to rehearse, really emotional things, I don't like to rehearse. You just beat it to death.
author: Kat Dennings

text: Death is not the end. There remains the litigation over the estate.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: For a man who has done his natural duty, death is as natural as sleep.
author: George Santayana

text: As a comic, you try something and if it works you go with it and grind it to death.
author: Alexei Sayle

text: The die is set and Malcolm will not escape for the foolish talk he spoke against his benefactor, such a man, is worthy of death, and it would have been so, were it not for Muhammad's confidence that God would give him the victory over the enemies.
author: Louis Farrakhan

text: Once you accept your own death, all of a sudden you're free to live. You no longer care about your reputation. You no longer care except so far as your life can be used tactically to promote a cause you believe in.
author: Saul Alinsky

text: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
author: Plato

text: My death, taking the light from my eyes, gives back to the day the purity which they soiled.
author: Jean Racine

text: To die for one's country is such a worthy fate that all compete for so beautiful a death.
author: Pierre Corneille

text: To be honest, I'm scared to death of rollercoaster rides.
author: Liam Neeson

text: I might be deceiving myself but I do not think that I do have an inordinate fear of death.
author: A. N. Wilson

text: Death will be a great relief. No more interviews.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: Mendacity is a system that we live in. Liquor is one way out an death's the other.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: At the moment of death I hope to be surprised.
author: Ivan Illich

text: Men do not accept their prophets and slay them, but they love their martyrs and worship those whom they have tortured to death.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: Give me liberty or give me death.
author: Patrick Henry

text: Death is softer by far than tyranny.
author: Aeschylus

text: We cannot banish dangers, but we can banish fears. We must not demean life by standing in awe of death.
author: David Sarnoff

text: If efforts to do social work are couched in selfish motives, then they will die a premature death. Why would my efforts get politicised? I have values I inherited from my father. He helped many. Anyone, even a postman knocking on our door would get a glass of water and some sweets.
author: Sachin Tendulkar

text: Death Valley is really wide-open - it's bigger than Rhode Island - and it's less a part of California than an ungoverned territory, so there's lots of weird cops-and-robbers stuff going on.
author: Gus Van Sant

text: Death in itself is nothing but we fear to be we know not what, we know not where.
author: John Dryden

text: It is a horrible fact that we can read in the daily paper, without interrupting our breakfast, numerical reckonings of death and destruction that ought to break our hearts or scare us out of our wits.
author: Wendell Berry

text: I believe that people would be alive today if there were a death penalty.
author: Nancy Reagan

text: A friend said to me, 'Be glad for your troubles - they strengthen you.' Well, if that's the truth, I'm going to be so strong they'll have to beat me to death!
author: Sonia Johnson

text: I had seen birth and death but had thought they were different.
author: T. S. Eliot

text: Knowing how to die is knowing how to live. What is death anyway? It's the outcome of life.
author: Jeanne Moreau

text: Death to me means nothing as long as I can die fast.
author: Bob Dylan

text: The kids out there want something they can relate to, something that's real most of that whiny stuff isn't real. The cheesy pop songs just bore me to death.
author: Jonathan Davis

text: I've told my children that when I die, to release balloons in the sky to celebrate that I graduated. For me, death is a graduation.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

text: Neither the sun nor death can be looked at with a steady eye.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Here I am trying to live, or rather, I am trying to teach the death within me how to live.
author: Jean Cocteau

text: It's just as idiotic to say there is no life after death as it is to say there is one.
author: Jeanne Moreau

text: If you wish to make a man look noble, your best course is to kill him. What superiority he may have inherited from his race, what superiority nature may have personally gifted him with, comes out in death.
author: Alexander Smith

text: There are certain people that are marked for death. I have my little list of those that treated me unfairly.
author: Jennifer Lopez

text: Death and love are the two wings that bear the good man to heaven.
author: Michelangelo

text: Absolute silence leads to sadness. It is the image of death.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Nothing that is really good and God-like dies.
author: Ernst Moritz Arndt

text: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
author: Coco Chanel

text: Where is the politician who has not promised to fight to the death for lower taxes- and who has not proceeded to vote for the very spending projects that make tax cuts impossible?
author: Barry Goldwater

text: If life must not be taken too seriously, then so neither must death.
author: Samuel Butler

text: It is a sign of creeping inner death when we can no longer praise the living.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: It is easy to go down into Hell night and day, the gates of dark Death stand wide but to climb back again, to retrace one's steps to the upper air - there's the rub, the task.
author: Virgil

text: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.
author: John Keats

text: Should I perchance still feel after my death, I would no longer have any doubt, but I would most certainly give the lie to anyone asserting before me that I was dead.
author: Giacomo Casanova

text: It's not life or death it's a game and at the end of the game there is going to be a winner and a loser.
author: Bernhard Langer

text: In the night of death, hope sees a star, and listening love can hear the rustle of a wing.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: Life without idealism is empty indeed. We just hope or starve to death.
author: Pearl S. Buck

text: On neither the sun, nor death, can a man look fixedly.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Creativity is not merely the innocent spontaneity of our youth and childhood it must also be married to the passion of the adult human being, which is a passion to live beyond one's death.
author: Rollo May

text: My father's death, my move, and my frightening and difficult delivery created a tremendous amount of stress, pain, and sadness for me. I was practically devastated beyond recovery.
author: Brooke Shields

text: The timing of death, like the ending of a story, gives a changed meaning to what preceded it.
author: Mary Catherine Bateson

text: The Greeks said grandly in their tragic phrase, 'Let no one be called happy till his death' to which I would add, 'Let no one, till his death, be called unhappy.'
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: Some people are so afraid do die that they never begin to live.
author: Henry Van Dyke

text: As long as you have capital punishment there is no guarantee that innocent people won't be put to death.
author: Paul Simon

text: I stay way from that area, and there's only so many songs you can write about love, sex and death.
author: Peter Steele

text: Death was like love, a romantic escape.
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: Had it not been for slavery, the death penalty would have likely been abolished in America. Slavery became a haven for the death penalty.
author: Angela Davis

text: If physical death is the price that I must pay to free my white brothers and sisters from a permanent death of the spirit, then nothing can be more redemptive.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: The symbolic language of the crucifixion is the death of the old paradigm resurrection is a leap into a whole new way of thinking.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: More than 100 people have been sent to death row who were later exonerated because they weren't guilty or fairly tried. Most criminal defendants do not get adequate representation because there are not enough public defenders to represent them. There is a lot that is wrong.
author: John Grisham

text: I think about death a lot, like I think we all do. I don't think of suicide as an option, but as fun. It's an interesting idea that you can control how you go. It's this thing that's looming, and you can control it.
author: Ryan Gosling

text: Only a humanity to whom death has become as indifferent as its members, that has itself died, can inflict it administratively on innumerable people.
author: Theodor Adorno

text: Whenever I watch TV and see those poor starving kids all over the world, I can't help but cry. I mean I'd love to be skinny like that, but not with all those flies and death and stuff.
author: Mariah Carey

text: I look at 'Death Proof' and realize I had too much time.
author: Quentin Tarantino

text: Man dies of cold, not of darkness.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

text: After the writer's death, reading his journal is like receiving a long letter.
author: Jean Cocteau

text: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: If you live a life of make-believe, your life isn't worth anything until you do something that does challenge your reality. And to me, sailing the open ocean is a real challenge, because it's life or death.
author: Morgan Freeman

text: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
author: Albert Einstein

text: His death was the first time that Ed Wynn ever made anyone sad.
author: Red Skelton

text: You must not fear death, my lads defy him, and you drive him into the enemy's ranks.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: It's certain that the death of an actor can be on a television screen playing the same thing every week.
author: Giancarlo Esposito

text: If you don't have any fight in you, you might as well be dead.
author: Scott Caan

text: After your death you will be what you were before your birth.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Love and death are the two great hinges on which all human sympathies turn.
author: B. R. Hayden

text: I know not what others may choose but, as for me, give me liberty or give me death.
author: Patrick Henry

text: Generosity during life is a very different thing from generosity in the hour of death one proceeds from genuine liberality and benevolence, the other from pride or fear.
author: Horace Mann

text: I don't believe in life after death. But I do believe in some grinding destiny that watches over us on earth. If I didn't, the safety valve would give and the boiler would explode.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: A nation or civilization that continues to produce soft-minded men purchases its own spiritual death on the installment plan.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: When I did 'Bumble-ardy,' I was so intensely aware of death. Eugene, my friend and partner, was dying here in the house when I did 'Bumble-ardy'. I did 'Bumble-ardy' to save myself. I did not want to die with him. I wanted to live, as any human being does.
author: Maurice Sendak

text: The illness, and the untimely death of my brothers, has made me conscious of the fact that - rather than just think about it - it's crucial that you do today what you want to do.
author: Robin Gibb

text: War is not the only arena where peace is done to death.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

text: Feminists bore me to death. I follow my instinct and if that supports young girls in any way, great. But I'd rather they saw it more as a lesson about following their own instincts rather than imitating somebody.
author: Bjork

text: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.
author: Judy Garland

text: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.
author: Plato

text: Loved. You can't use it in the past tense. Death does not stop that love at all.
author: Ken Kesey

text: I never really got on that well with Yoko anyway. Strangely enough, I only started to get to know her after John's death.
author: Paul McCartney

text: In our brief national history we have shot four of our presidents, worried five of them to death, impeached one and hounded another out of office. And when all else fails, we hold an election and assassinate their character.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: Let no one weep for me, or celebrate my funeral with mourning for I still live, as I pass to and fro through the mouths of men.
author: Quintus Ennius

text: See, I have set before you this day life and good, death and evil... I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse therefore choose life.
author: Moses

text: Judged by the law of England, I know this crime entails upon me the penalty of death but the history of Ireland explains that crime and justifies it.
author: Thomas Francis Meagher

text: I don't think of death in a romantic way anymore.
author: Robert Smith

text: What is the value of sticking a microphone in a man's face right after he has learned of his wife's death?
author: Jessica Savitch

text: Hearing nuns' confessions is like being stoned to death with popcorn.
author: Fulton J. Sheen

text: Coming to terms with the fear of death is conducive to healing, positive personality transformation, and consciousness evolution.
author: Stanislav Grof

text: Yes, people pull the trigger - but guns are the instrument of death. Gun control is necessary, and delay means more death and horror.
author: Eliot Spitzer

text: Families survive, one way or another. You have a tie, a connection that exists long after death, through many lifetimes.
author: Jessica Lange

text: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a way of life foolish people are idle, wise people are diligent.
author: Buddha

text: I think people would be alive today if there were a death penalty.
author: Nancy Reagan

text: Without health life is not life it is only a state of langour and suffering - an image of death.
author: Buddha

text: The fear of death often proves mortal, and sets people on methods to save their Lives, which infallibly destroy them.
author: Joseph Addison

text: Nothing in life is promised except death.
author: Kanye West

text: A tragedy need not have blood and death it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
author: Jean Racine

text: Death is the sanction of everything the story-teller can tell. He has borrowed his authority from death.
author: Walter Benjamin

text: The fear of death comes from limited awareness.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Fear of death makes us devoid both of valour and religion. For want of valour is want of religious faith.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Life inspires more dread than death - it is life which is the great unknown.
author: Emile M. Cioran

text: Defoe says that there were a hundred thousand country fellows in his time ready to fight to the death against popery, without knowing whether popery was a man or a horse.
author: William Hazlitt

text: Somehow, knowing that Alzheimer's is coming mocks all one's aspirations - to tell stories, to think through certain issues as only a novel can do, to be recognised for one's accomplishments and hard work - in a way that old familiar death does not.
author: Jane Smiley

text: When the will defies fear, when duty throws the gauntlet down to fate, when honor scorns to compromise with death - that is heroism.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: My life comes down to three moments: the death of my father, meeting my husband, and the birth of my daughter. Everything I did previous to that just doesn't seem to add up to very much.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

text: Giving is good, but taking is bad and brings death.
author: Hesiod

text: Life is better than death, I believe, if only because it is less boring, and because it has fresh peaches in it.
author: Alice Walker

text: He has not lived badly whose birth and death has been unnoticed by the world.
author: Horace

text: When you're dead, you're dead. That's it.
author: Marlene Dietrich

text: A man may devote himself to death and destruction to save a nation but no nation will devote itself to death and destruction to save mankind.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: I think the way we talk about cancer has really evolved. I remember the way my grandmother used to talk about it, like a death sentence, no-one would even mention the word.
author: Laura Linney

text: Death doesn't frighten me now I can think peacefully of ending a long life.
author: Jeanne Calment
